page.title: 06WORKING IN A HOSPITAL.
page.content: A surgeon at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital has a very busy life. At 8a.m. each morning he meets a team of doctors and visits wards to see at least 30 patients. He then sees out-patients in the clinic until lunch time. During the afternoon he does about 8 operations. When he has finished in the operating theatre he goes back to the wards to check on more patients before he can go home. He is 'on call' for emergencies every third night. Nurses start their work at 7.30a.m. by reading the reports of thoae who have done night duty. They then go to each patient to see if they are comfortable. After taking round the breakfasts the nurses prepare patients for operations, change dressings and give treatment where necessary. Their working day finishes at 5.00p.m.
